3. **Conciseness & Structure**  
   - Trim repetitive sentences.

**Revised Core Paragraph (example)**  

> **Base case (2025‑2028):** Long‑term U.S. Treasury yields (ust10y) will trend upward to 6.5 % → 7.5 %, mirroring mortgage rates that have hovered near 7 % since the Fed’s September 2024 cuts.  
> **Catalyst (Sept 16‑17 2025):** Fed policy meeting – a change in the fed funds rate or balance‑sheet pace will shift ust10y and mortgage rates.  
> **Risks:**  
> 1. Fed rate hike → higher ust10y → higher mortgage rates.  
> 2. Inflation spike → lenders raise rates to protect margins.  
> 3. Rising national debt → higher borrowing costs → upward pressure on ust10y and mortgage rates.  
> **Watch:** Fed meetings, inflation data releases, debt trajectory, and housing‑market demand indicators.  

This version meets the acceptance gate, maintains focus on the housing/capex cycle, and follows the concise, actionable style.
